# Phase 5: Advanced Features (Target: Weeks 9-11)

## Purpose
Implement computationally intensive analyses and leverage web-only capabilities not available in the TUI.

## Why This Matters
These features differentiate the web version from the TUI. WebGPU enables massive parallelism impossible in terminals. WebRTC enables collaboration impossible in local apps. Video export enables sharing impossible without GUIs.

## Deliverables
1. **Advanced Analysis Overlays** - K-mer, module detection, selection pressure
2. **WebGPU Acceleration** - GPU k-mer counting, parallel analysis
3. **Collaborative Sessions** - WebRTC-based real-time collaboration
4. **Export Capabilities** - Clipboard, FASTA, video, file system
5. **Matrix Rain Effect** - Background visual effect

## Advanced Analyses

### K-mer Anomaly Cartography
- High-resolution k-mer frequency deviation
- Windowed analysis across genome
- Anomaly highlighting

### Module Detection
- Functional gene clustering
- Operon boundary prediction
- Regulatory region identification

### Selection Pressure (dN/dS)
- Synonymous vs non-synonymous ratio
- Per-gene and sliding window
- Evolutionary pressure visualization

### Transcription Flow
- Promoter strength mapping
- Terminator detection
- Transcription unit visualization

## Web-Only Features

### WebGPU Compute (Feature Flagged)
```typescript
// GPU-accelerated k-mer counting
// 10-100x speedup for large sequences
async function gpuKmerCount(sequence, k): Map<string, number>
```

### WebRTC Collaboration
```typescript
class CollaborationManager {
  createSession(): Promise<string>  // Returns session ID
  joinSession(id): Promise<void>    // Join existing session
  broadcastStateChange(change): void // Sync with peers
}
```

### Export Capabilities
| Format | API Used |
|--------|----------|
| Rich clipboard | Clipboard API (HTML + plain) |
| FASTA | Clipboard/File System Access |
| Video | WebCodecs |
| Files | File System Access API |

### Matrix Rain
- DNA/amino acid characters
- Background decoration during loading
- Configurable density and speed

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All advanced analyses complete in reasonable time (<30s for 100kb)
- [ ] Progress streaming shows incremental results
- [ ] Results match TUI implementation exactly
- [ ] WebGPU provides measurable speedup (where supported)
- [ ] Collaboration sessions work between two browsers
- [ ] All export formats produce valid output

## Browser Support Matrix
| Feature | Chrome | Firefox | Safari |
|---------|--------|---------|--------|
| WebGPU | ✅ | 🚧 | 🚧 |
| File System Access | ✅ | ❌ | ❌ |
| WebCodecs | ✅ | 🚧 | ❌ |
| WebRTC | ✅ | ✅ | ✅ |

## Risks & Mitigations
- **Risk**: WebGPU not widely available
  - **Mitigation**: Feature flag, graceful fallback to WASM
- **Risk**: File System Access limited support
  - **Mitigation**: Fall back to download/input elements
- **Risk**: Collaboration signaling complexity
  - **Mitigation**: Use simple edge function, not full TURN server

## Dependencies
- Phase 4 (worker orchestration for heavy compute)
- Phase 3 (overlays to display results)
- Edge functions for collaboration signaling

## NEW DIRECTION: Wire Up WebGL2 + Enhance with Libretro CRT Shaders

### Background

The existing `PostProcessingPipeline.ts` (313 lines) has a solid WebGL2 foundation:
- Full-screen quad rendering
- Texture upload from canvas
- Scanlines, chromatic aberration, bloom, vignette, noise

But it's **never wired up** - `PostProcessingCanvas.tsx` exists but is never rendered.

### New Goal

1. **Wire up the existing pipeline** - Render PostProcessingCanvas in AppShell
2. **Enhance with libretro-style CRT shaders** inspired by `slang-shaders/crt/shaders/newpixie`

### Effects to Add (from newpixie-crt)

| Effect | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| **Screen Curvature** | Barrel distortion simulating CRT geometry |
| **Shadow Mask** | Phosphor dot pattern overlay |
| **Rolling Scanlines** | Animated horizontal refresh lines |
| **Ghosting** | Temporal color bleeding |
| **Film Tone Mapping** | Filmic curve for color grading |

### Implementation Plan

1. **Phase 1: Wire Up** (Quick win)
   - Import PostProcessingCanvas into AppShell
   - Connect to settings (scanlines, bloom, aberration toggles)
   - Verify basic effects work

2. **Phase 2: Enhanced Shaders** (libretro-inspired)
   - Add curvature uniform + barrel distortion
   - Add shadow mask pattern
   - Add ghosting via temporal buffer
   - Add proper multi-pass bloom

3. **Phase 3: Settings UI**
   - Add sliders for: curvature, scanline intensity, bloom strength
   - Preset modes: "Subtle", "Classic CRT", "NewPixie", "Off"

### Files to Modify

- `packages/web/src/components/layout/AppShell.tsx` - Add PostProcessingCanvas
- `packages/web/src/rendering/PostProcessingPipeline.ts` - Enhance shaders
- `packages/web/src/components/overlays/SettingsOverlay.tsx` - Add CRT controls
- `packages/web/src/store/createWebStore.ts` - Add CRT settings state

### Reference

- Libretro slang-shaders: https://github.com/libretro/slang-shaders
- Specifically: `crt/shaders/newpixie/newpixie-crt.slang`

### Why This Matters

The retro CRT aesthetic is core to Phage Explorer's visual identity. Proper WebGL2 effects will be much more impressive than CSS overlays and enable future shader-based visualizations.

# Phase 6: Polish & Launch (Target: Weeks 11-13)

## Purpose
Final quality pass before public launch. Performance optimization, accessibility compliance, onboarding experience, and documentation.

## Why This Matters
First impressions matter. A slow, inaccessible, or confusing launch destroys user trust. This phase ensures the app is polished, inclusive, and welcoming.

## Deliverables
1. **Performance Audit** - Lighthouse 90+, bundle optimization
2. **Accessibility Review** - WCAG 2.1 AA compliance
3. **First-Run Onboarding** - Welcome flow and tour
4. **TUI Mode Skin** - Terminal purist option
5. **Error Handling** - Boundaries, recovery, telemetry
6. **Documentation** - User guide, developer docs

## Performance Targets
| Metric | Target |
|--------|--------|
| First Contentful Paint | <1.0s |
| Largest Contentful Paint | <1.5s |
| Time to Interactive | <2.0s |
| Cumulative Layout Shift | <0.1 |
| Lighthouse Performance | >90 |

## Accessibility Requirements

### WCAG 2.1 AA Compliance
- [ ] Color contrast ratios meet 4.5:1 minimum
- [ ] All interactive elements keyboard accessible
- [ ] Focus indicators visible and consistent
- [ ] Screen reader announces all content
- [ ] Reduced motion mode available
- [ ] High contrast theme available

### Implementation
```
- ARIA labels on all interactive elements
- Focus trap in modals
- Skip navigation link
- Semantic HTML structure
- Announce dynamic content changes
```

## Onboarding Experience

### First-Run Flow
1. Welcome modal with app overview
2. Experience level selection (Novice/Intermediate/Power)
3. Feature tour highlighting key interactions
4. Quick keyboard shortcut primer
5. Sample phage loaded for exploration

### Progressive Discovery
- Tooltips on first hover of each element
- Context-sensitive help (? key)
- "What's new" for returning users

## TUI Mode
For terminal purists:
- Maximum scanline intensity
- Reduced animations
- Pure monospace aesthetic
- Minimal chrome
- High contrast by default

## Error Handling
```typescript
class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component {
  componentDidCatch(error, errorInfo) {
    // Log to telemetry
    // Show recovery UI
    // Offer "Report Bug" action
  }
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Lighthouse score >90 in all categories
- [ ] Screen reader fully navigable
- [ ] Keyboard-only usage possible
- [ ] Error states are graceful and helpful
- [ ] Cold start <2s on broadband
- [ ] Documentation covers all features
- [ ] First-run experience is welcoming

## Launch Checklist
- [ ] DNS configured for phage-explorer.com (or similar)
- [ ] Vercel deployment verified
- [ ] Analytics/telemetry operational
- [ ] Error monitoring active
- [ ] Social preview images set
- [ ] GitHub repo linked
- [ ] Announcement prepared

## Risks & Mitigations
- **Risk**: Accessibility issues missed
  - **Mitigation**: Use axe, WAVE, real screen reader testing
- **Risk**: Performance regression at launch
  - **Mitigation**: Continuous Lighthouse CI, bundle size alerts
- **Risk**: Onboarding too complex
  - **Mitigation**: User testing, iterate on flow

## Dependencies

- Content for documentation
- Analytics infrastructure decision
